However, as the university expanded, a university council was established composed of vice rectors, deans, and consultants to divide up the task. This council adheres to the internal structure of the university and takes all the necessary and important decisions so as to progress all the academic programs. International relations, for example, is taught in cooperation with international universities located in Switzerland, France, Australia, and Canada. Currently, we have been working on obtaining accreditation from international institutions, specifically two located in Italy and the US. This university is a non-profit academic institution that receives tuition fees from students that in turn should be sufficient to fund professors, laboratories, infrastructure, and any expenses the university incurs. Moreover, ULS follows the Lebanese Maronite congregation, which is able to financially support the university when the funds are insufficient, specifically during difficult socio-economic times such as now. The Lebanese Maronite congregation has generously contributed $700,000 to ULS to help fund its activities.
node.sections11: In 2013, the Lebanese American University (LAU) spent between $40 million and $45 million, aside from equipment. We also have a capital investment plan that has $333 million in provisions. Currently, there are two buildings under construction in Byblos. One of them will house the engineering hall and the other will be a library. We are also working on the Byblos campus infrastructure, which will cost over $30 million, as well as revamping the power plant and improving the wastewater system. We have also just inaugurated a state-of-the-art building, the Gilbert and Rose-Marie Chagoury Health Sciences Center, to house the School of Medicine, School of Nursing, and School of Pharmacy. I believe that any talented student should be given an opportunity to come to LAU, regardless of social or economic background. Our budget for 2014-2015 is $157.7 million, $20 million of which is allocated for scholarships. This allocation has increased greatly in the last five years. We are looking ahead all the time. We are even looking at starting programs that aim to ensure adequate training for human resources and the expertise we need to extract gas and oil in Lebanon. As an innovative institution, we should play a major role in terms of providing engineers for the oil and gas industry. In recruiting for the new programs, we always try to attract expatriates back to Lebanon and we have been extremely successful in that regard.
node.sections21: Our most visible investments are the new facilities that have recently been completed on the AUB campus—including two at the Medical Center. One building, the Wassef and Souad Sawwaf Building, is a gift from one of our new trustees, Mu'taz Sawwaf, and houses the university health services as well as a new PET-CT scanner and cyclotron, equipment that will improve our capacities for on-site medical imaging and diagnosis. In addition, our new medical administration building is about to open, enabling AUB to implement the first phase of our new vision for the medical center expansion, scheduled to culminate in 2020. These facilities have been complemented by the establishment of new research centers of excellence at the hospital and the hiring of newly recruited physicians, reversing the traditional “brain drain“ that has been plaguing Lebanon. On the main campus, we have also added a major complex for our Faculty of Engineering and Architecture, which consists primarily of new laboratories as well as spaces for teaching and for graduate student study areas. This new facility is named after Ray Irani, former co-chairman of our Board of Trustees who served for many years as the CEO of Occidental Petroleum. The fourth major building is for the Issam Fares Institute for Public Policy and International Affairs. It is designed by the world-renowned Iraqi architect, Zaha Hadid, whose iconic and futuristic structure is the first of her buildings to be completed in the Middle East.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Logistics Solutions
node.title: Whatever Your Medium
node.sections01: The time definite delivery of documents and packages remains our core business and is what we are mostly focused on. Our time definite service continues to improve thanks to our continuous investment in our network and facilities. DHL remains the market leader in the express industry, and we continue to grow in market share and revenues. We invest in every arm of our business, including our network, technology, fleet, facilities, and processes; however, the most fundamental share of our investment is on our people. We have a world-class international training program that every single member of our organization across the world undergoes.
node.sections11: In Lebanon, we can say that 3PL is definitely our niche. We foresee more demand on the way as it isn't yet a mature market, with some major traders that still resist the idea of putting their cargo in warehouses that they do not control themselves. We used to ship from all over the world, but the focus is definitely on Asia and Europe at present. We no longer focus on land freight in the MEA region because clients are hesitant regarding land freight in the current insecure climate; therefore, are requesting alternative services. We offer existing customers the ocean alternative and in the process have secured new ones to add to the trade.
node.sections21: We used to work about 50% by land, and now it is about 20%. It was 30% by sea, now it is 50%. By air, it was about 15%, but now accounts for 25%-30% of our shipments. Things have changed. Shipping by land is more dangerous now, and it was even impossible for three or four months in the past year or so. Recently, some roads reopened, which has allowed us to ship again; however, there are still some challenges. Another specialized market for us is in handling time-sensitive cargo such as medicine and food products; a market that has been growing lately. Additionally, we also offer complete supply chain solutions, from order management to storage to distribution.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Why Lebanon?
node.title: Talent Pool
node.sections01: When we started, the market was excellent because it was just recovering from the war. It was positive, very upbeat and encouraging. We started our operations in October 2010 with our flagship store, Centrepoint, in City Mall; from there, the success story started. Today, four years later, we are operating nine stores and employing more than 400+ persons, amongst whom 90% are Lebanese. In spite of the turbulence and many challenges in the market, the months of April to July 2014 have been great for us; we are positive that going forward the business will be fabulous. We have grown consistently in Lebanon and our performance is stable. Our strengths lie in the two pillars of efficient operations and logistics; we are cost-effective, proficient in supply chain management, and we use our resources optimally. The Lebanese market is a little more mature than the Gulf market. Customers are very knowledgeable, demanding, and fashion conscious. There is cutthroat competition, but still the value segment is one where we can stand out, especially when providing excellent customer service.
node.sections11: When there has been hardship or strife in Lebanon, it has brought out our passion, not slowed it down. The company is insistent on staying in Lebanon and turning negatives into positives. The company believes in this country no matter what. The best way to fight extremist ideas is by becoming more prosperous. The most prominent trend is the shift toward digital, which poses a challenge as one has to respond and adapt quickly. People are anticipating and embracing everything digital, but the local infrastructure is not up to international standards yet; however, once in place, the shift will be an overnight revolution. We have seen this already with smartphones. This is an indication that people are ready to “jump on the digital bandwagon.“ As such, digital is no longer a separate department in an agency; rather, every department needs to be digitally switched on. I do not mean everyone needs to be a programming expert, but everyone needs to be well versed in all the latest digital trends and developments. Leo Burnett is making sure its people are prepared in this respect.
node.sections21: Novartis was brought to life on a global level in 1996 with a merger between two companies, Ciba-Geigy and Sandoz Laboratories. These two companies had been deeply rooted in Lebanon for 50 years serving the medical community in the country. Though separate entities, they had excellent portfolios, which also partook in manufacturing activities. In 1996, following the merger on a global level, Novartis was formed, and since then it has been a leader in Lebanon as well as in the region. Until a few years back, the Lebanon office was a country-based operation that reported back to a Middle East cluster. About two-and-a-half years ago, we formed the Levant sub-cluster, where Lebanon is currently the regional hub for Lebanon, Syria, Iraq, and Iran. At the time, Levant was formed, the Lebanon representative office had about 20 to 25 associates, and now there are more than 100. For me, Lebanon is a laboratory where we create innovation. This country is driven by innovation and embraces it too. Human talent here is unique and not too costly.
node.sections31: One of the selling points for Citi is its globalism. Our footprint spans over 100 countries, including Lebanon. Historically, prior to the civil war, Lebanon used to be the financial center for the region. Beirut played an important role, and Citi has been present here since the early 1950s. Even though we closed in 1988 because of the civil war, we reestablished our presence and commitment to Lebanon in 1995. For Citi, Lebanon is an important center despite shifting dynamics, and not only for Citi but for other multinationals, which saw the rise of other centers such as Dubai. Lebanon still represents a significant part of our operations for a number of reasons, one of which is that we view Lebanon as an excellent talent pool. We are a global bank; we need to cater to clients from diverse cultures, in a number of regions that speak other languages. Hence, in Lebanon it is easier to find talent that is open, trilingual, and has a good educational background. This is one of the major reasons that we value the franchise. The second factor is our history in the country and the role we played throughout the civil war era.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Automotive
node.title: Changing Lanes
node.sections01: The automotive industry is very much related to the economy and stability. If it goes well, the trend will go well. If it goes down, the sales of the car industry will drop and shift toward cheaper cars. It all depends on where we are headed. It is a challenging market. At times some dealers dump prices for the sake of sales, which creates a negative momentum in the market. It is difficult not to follow them, but sometimes you need to in order to maintain a certain margin and to lead. This is a tricky thing. It is a difficult market, and it is constantly shifting. Creative doesn't necessarily mean successful. A creative strategy can be a failure, too. The most creative was the multi-balloon structure. This was a financial system to help people afford a car. It does this by creating what we called “balloons.“ For example, you pay a regular installment every month; however, if you get a bonus at work then you are able to pay a larger “balloon“ payment and then return to paying the regular payment. Basically, people are able to have bigger cars on a smaller budget. It was creative, but it is difficult to advertise it. When a person comes, it is easy for them to get confused. You need a creative mind to understand this concept. People tend to like simplicity. It was a creative financial strategy.
node.sections11: ANB is one of Mazda's oldest distributors in the world. Initially, the Mazda brand was not well known; however, today it is recognized for its reliability, quality, and a mixture of many other attributes. It is a beautiful car from the outside in. The craftsmanship is excellent and the engineering is Japanese, produced in Japan. Mazda cars have a five-year warranty with unlimited miles that no one else provides, and we provide extensive after-sales service. This is the key to Mazda's success in the automotive business today. You have to do more than sell the car; it is also about what comes afterwards. This means the body shop, the paint shop, the insurance, fixing mechanical problems, maintenance, spare parts availability—the whole suite of services. This is why twice we have been recognized as providing the best customer service for Mazda in the world. We won an award that we received in Turkey from Arabia 500 relating to being one of fastest growing company in its field among companies in Arab countries and Turkey—they call it Arabia 500 plus Turkey. In 2012-2013, we were named as one of the fastest growing Lebanese companies. We received several other awards in 2013 for our marketing ability.
node.sections21: At Porsche Centre Lebanon, we recently introduced several new products, such as the new generation Panamera, 911 Turbo, and Turbo S and the all-new Macan. We are enjoying a clear demand for them. As usual in the first year of production, we have a limited quota for the Macan in 2014. I am pleased to say that we have already taken binding customer orders for over 70% of our allocation, which, given the current times, is a fantastic achievement. No wonder, our new product offer is the perfect, all-round, four-door sports car and people here love it, given their preference for high-rise vehicles with outstanding driving performance. We are furthermore looking forward to the introduction of the new 911 Targa generation, which is expected to arrive next month. Our model range has never been more attractive than today, and I am hopeful that this will give us the necessary basis to keep our sales as stable as possible despite challenging economic times. The 2013 performance matched that of 2012, with close to 300 new cars delivered to Lebanese customers across the country. Given factors beyond our control, we are satisfied with our 2013 results.

node.author: TBY
node.previewsummary: Insurance companies are looking for ways to increase awareness and education about their products as they look to increase penetration and market share.
node.subject: Insurance Angles
node.title: Back Up Is Here
node.sections01: Islamic insurance, or takaful, is the same as conventional insurance, with the only difference being that at the end of year the profits are redistributed to the policyholders, whereas in conventional insurance profits are redistributed among the shareholders. The main advantage of Islamic insurance is to achieve the principles of cooperation among participants in Islamic sharia principles of equality and integrity. That is the main difference. Otherwise, the insurance process is almost the same. Islamic insurance can be considered one of the largest growing industries in the world. We are working through our own bank, Al Baraka. Although growth has been slow, it is happening nevertheless. We are increasing our network of brokers and offering more and more direct lines, which creates a more personal relationship with customers. Our customers and brokers prefer to work with Al Aman Takaful because they see that we have better ratings, better services, and better facilities. Working with brokers and attracting the right ones is an excellent way to improve your exposure, because they all bring with them a basket of clients they can direct your way. Meaning if you can persuade the brokers of the quality of what you offer and your services, then you are thereby increasing your market share and exposure almost directly. We prefer to deal mainly with small-to-medium-sized brokers, those who are interested in doing business and getting their commissions, as opposed to large brokers who impose their own regulations on the insurance companies, and even impose their own clauses. All in all, we have a solid business plan, and we are expecting to see some good results over the coming years.
node.sections11: There is definitely better growth in the life insurance business than in the non-life segment. With the struggling economy, we foresaw that our retail business would decelerate, as we experienced in marine cargo a decrease in the sub-issued component and it appeared that more people were opening letters of credit (LCs) for smaller amounts out of prudence in a time of economic slowdown. Marine cargo insurance tends to follow the general economic trend, and so we expect lower premium generation from policies as customers are only importing what they need for a shorter time period, rather than building up stock. On the other hand, during periods of drawback, people tend to save by buying life investment products for essential needs, one of them being education plans for their kids. We have two young, well-performing companies in Egypt: AROPE Life Insurance S.A.E and AROPE Insurance for Properties & Liabilities S.A.E, and once greater stability takes hold we foresee solid performance. We offer the same products and services in Egypt as we do in Lebanon, including retirement and education plans, as well as a raft of non-life products.
node.sections21: At VICTOIRE, we leverage our experience, meaning we know what to give our clients, and we know what they need or don't need. We have a close relationship with our clients, which is essential if you are going to provide tailor-made policies and products. We talk to them, listen to them, understand their needs, and never impose ourselves upon them. Ultimately, our job is to provide options, and then it is up to the client to approve and go with it, otherwise we change it until it has suited our clients' expectations. This approach has been a fundamental element of our growth, because back when VICTOIRE started off as a brokerage representing other insurance firms, it was the investment from our clients that enabled VICTOIRE to become a standalone insurance company. In other words, our clients became our shareholders, and that was simply because we had their trust, we had a partnership relationship with them, and they didn't think twice about becoming shareholders in VICTOIRE as a fully-fledged insurance company providing its own policies. We are not owned by a bank, and we are not owned by any leading financial or political interests in Lebanon. We have only one focus and one interest: the business of providing insurance. VICTOIRE is a family-managed company, ultimately, and this is reflected in the shareholders as well, which are the Sultanem family, the Rizit family, and the Shamaoun family, among other smaller shareholders. Though it is family managed, it is not family owned.
node.sections31: In Lebanon the main two insurance policies we sell are car insurance and medical insurance; this is how you penetrate the market initially. These are the two basic forms of insurance that everyone uses in Lebanon. When I say “car and medical,“ they represent about 60%-65% of the portfolio, while the rest is general business. There are some companies that only do life, but for us, the companies that work only in life are not as big as the other insurance companies. Some of the companies that have banks on their backs get life policies automatically. Whenever anyone takes out a loan, they have to have life insurance as well. Their life portfolio might be bigger because there is a bank that is behind them. Each policy that we have in this company is sold without a bank's assistance. This is unfortunate in Lebanon because the banks that own insurance companies oblige you to go to one insurance company and this is not professional. We are trying to keep our prices competitive, but there are some policies where I do not play with the price. For example, third party bodily injury (TPBI) motor insurance policy is one area we do not play with the price. Actually, Al Mashrek was the first company to create this policy in Lebanon. My father created this policy with the government and a single policy cost $50. Most other companies played with the price; but we didn't. Today, those companies that sold the policy at less than $50 are in big trouble due to the accidents that are happening. The courts are being more generous in compensation claims, creating big problems for those who undercut the standard rate. Many have now gone back to $50, but there were four or five years where they were playing with the price.
node.sections41: Bancassurance is a specific business model brought from the south of Europe, though it has not taken off in the MENA region yet. Now this model is spreading all over the world, in the South and North of Europe, in Asia, and there are some reflector countries such as the UK, and the US. In the US, it has changed; it is an interesting model that has become very profitable. This is true in Lebanon as well. This is because the only channel of distribution of bank insurance is the bank, so there are no agents or brokers. Here in Lebanon, three banks make up the capital of Bancassurance: Fransabank, BLC Bank, and Banque Libano-Française—three powerful alpha banks. Bancassurance defines what products to implement and serve life insurance for the different banks. Bancassurance designs its products to respond to clients' needs, makes the actuarial studies, and also negotiates with the reinsurer, meaning we have the full package. This is why it is so successful. After, we sell life products through the branches. In fact, the model is very profitable because you sell at any branch for a much lower cost. If you sell by a broker or agent then the commission is very high, and if it's at the branch the commission is low. And for the clients, the model allows them to have all their financial and insurance services answered at one place, meaning the bank has bank become a “one-stop-shop.“

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Industrial Outlook
node.title: How To Optimize
node.sections01: We currently have a strong recruitment strategy. We are planning to increase our head count in order to support the launching of new products and product categories into different segments. Jean-Claude Yared & Fils is currently known mainly for pipes and fittings, but there are still many products we could expand into. The strategy is to keep introducing new products and developing them into new segments with the right customers and team members. The goal is to consistently increase the market share in respective product divisions, and, of course, increase the company's market share as a whole while maintaining sound, logical returns.
node.sections11: Karambois was started three generations ago by my grandfather in Beirut, Lebanon. It then expanded into the Levant area under the leadership of my grandfather and his sons. The company gradually established its position as a major player in the region. Our company has evolved over the years and is today at the forefront of the regional timber market, particularly in Lebanon. Although the market has drastically changed over the last decades, we continuously strive to expand and optimize our operations and to diversify our product range in an effort to satisfy the market's needs. Our major obstacle remains, of course, the persistent instability in the country, which often halts expansion and diversification plans. This instability, however, also drives us to optimize our business to make sure we are always ready to deal with a volatile local market, especially for our hospitality business.
node.sections21: Since we started, we have been trying to find the right partners. We don't work with just anyone; we have to be conservative. When we work with someone it is because, at the end of the day, we are suppliers and they are going to cut, assemble, and perform the installation. If the fabricators are not fabricating their product in the right way, this affects our image as well, as both the system quality and the installation quality of the system are interdependent. This is why, when we chose a fabricator, we have certain criteria to ensure they deliver the highest quality. That is why we only work with select companies. We supervise because we have to be sure they deliver the right product in the right place with the right image.
node.sections31: The Lebanese ceramics market is developing, and displaying a continuous higher demand due to the increase of construction projects that are being executed and the material knowledge that people are gaining. That is why the Lebanese government should focus on improving this sector by creating financial and geographical facilities to enhance the production and the manufacturing of ceramics.

node.author: TBY
node.intervieweelist0position: Senior Vice-President for Argentina, Chile, & Colombia
node.intervieweelist2position: Country Manager for Colombia and Ecuador
node.title: Better Than C++
node.sections01: I think Colombia has experienced a technological leap in many senses. Our ICT sector is doing a great job, although there is always room for improvement. This is an open market, and I believe private companies will realize their own transformations. This is an excellent market for Oracle, that offers numerous opportunities, and the government is also assisting considerably. The standard of education in Colombia is high, and therefore there are many skilled, young professionals available. At Oracle, we hire and train them to provide various ICT services, both for the local market and overseas. Colombian professionals are a key reason why we have chosen Colombia, and not another country, for our activities. We work with a diversity of companies, small, medium, and large, and engaged in all industry sectors, as well as working with the government. This said, we do pay particular attention to certain industries, namely communications, financial institutions, retail, and government, because Oracle's offering covers whatever might be required. These segments are growing steadily in Colombia.
node.sections11: We have to penetrate further with broadband, especially in the poorer parts of Colombia. That will help us develop the country and improve the way Colombians live. I believe the desire is there from the public sector, and everyday there is more alignment in the private sector to work toward executing initiatives with the government. One of the most important infrastructure projects is the building of a Wi-Fi network for the people, something that will bolster the democratic process. Another priority is developing everything around “Big Data." Our main public sectors are health and education, and in the private sector we are focusing on oil and gas. We have concentrated our efforts in Bogotá, and to some extent in Medellí­n, meaning that one or two years ago more than 90% of our business was in these two cities. Then, after the first peace talks, a number of cities including Cali, Barranquilla, and Bucaramanga, started growing. The growth of medium-sized companies is driving the market, and we are looking for coverage.
node.sections21: Without technology there is no way to develop our industrial matrix and take advantage of the emerging market and drive the country to the next level of growth. The government's policies for ICT are fostering corporate growth. One of the more interesting developments in Colombia is the emergence of one of the largest communities of social media users for websites such as Facebook and Twitter, and most of the nation is excelling in terms of technology uptake. Since 2012 we have grown by close to 91%, almost doubling the Colombian operation. We have also almost doubled our staff base, and doubled our revenue. Competition is coming to Colombia, and the country is being noticed abroad because of the investment environment. One of the reasons SAP is growing is because we have the technology to help it do so.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Construction Scene
node.title: Block By Block
node.sections01: Saudi Arabia is probably one of the most important countries that we have in the Middle East. It is the strongest country we have at the moment. We are finding that the need for project management in the private sector is becoming more prevalent. Hill International is getting more calls from people in the private sector, which in the past didn’t use project management because they thought they could manage things on their own. However, they are realizing that having a project management company not only gives them the structure that they need to manage the project, but also gives them the policies, procedures, and systems that are needed to manage their projects. When we sell our services to a private owner, we bring in established systems, policies, procedures, project controls, and quality people. At Hill International, we have such a large base for resourcing, and are able to provide project management, program management, and construction management, as well as perform design reviews, cost monitoring, training, and value engineering. We will sit with the client and understand their goals and objectives and design a program that will fit their budget, from design through to the grand opening of their project. The risk to a client of not having a project manager on board could be substantial. Project management companies, if they are doing their job correctly, will ensure the client is getting the design they approved on schedule and within budget.
node.sections11: Nesma and Partners started as a civil construction company. Later on, we made a joint venture with a US electromechanical group as well as with AGAP Arabia, an oil and gas construction company operating in Saudi Arabia. We had three companies under one management, all in different fields. In 2004, we decided to integrate those three companies into one, thus forming Nesma and Partners. Our expertise varies across diverse construction fields including oil and gas, construction, infrastructure and superstructure, power, roads, and also airports. We have a wide capability; thanks to the integration of those three companies. We have various projects we are working on now, including hospitals, taking part in building one of the three packages in the Riyadh metro project alongside our joint venture partners, and we are also building Phase I on Jabal Omar project consisting of several hotels in Mecca, right in front of the Kaaba. Hilton suites has already opened one hotel for business, while the others are scheduled to open on various intervals within the year. We also have industrial projects in Jubail; one is the nylon factory for Chevron Phillips and Petrochemical Conversion Company, the other is the packaging plant of the Sadara project. We have many repeat clients we are working with such as Aramco, in oil and gas mainly, SABIC, the National Guard, and many other clients.
node.sections21: Roots Group Arabia was established in 1982 in Saudi Arabia with one core activity, which was the wholesale of construction-related materials. It started with building materials, and now we account for a 40% market share in the gypsum board segment, which is one of our strongest products. Today, we operate in our markets across three platforms, distribution which is 60% of our business, construction with 25%, and manufacturing with 15%. We have also expanded our product offerings from materials to equipment such as construction equipment, tower cranes, power generators, and tools. In 2012, we signed on to be the distributors for CASE Construction equipment. However, we offer a host of products and equipment, including well-known brand names. In 2013, we acquired Ideal Standard MENA through a 40% stake. This provided us with the right know-how, as well as distribution and manufacturing capabilities. We have seven manufacturing plants in total; therefore, we are extremely active in adding new brands. Either we acquire new ones or enter into joint ventures to form agencies. Our objective is to increase our product mix in the sector and expand geographically. Both of these together are behind our decisions on how to move forward and grow. In the markets, we are present and our strategy is to have a leading market share. In order to achieve this, we have to maintain strength in the after-sales side of our business.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Refinancing
node.title: The Upper Rung
node.sections01: Since the company is still in the early stages of its development, the upward momentum is expected to grow for the next three years, although naturally this depends on the state of the market and the performance of new entrants, which could see business pan out differently. We plan to conduct our business as we have done to date to meet the new regulatory challenges, market needs and environment, and stakeholder expectations. The government has taken a number of initiatives to promote the real estate market, and one is to establish refinancing companies, similar to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac and others. If this initiative proves successful, it would bring a paradigm change to the way the real estate business is conducted in Saudi Arabia and contribute positively toward economic growth as a number of investors, particularly foreign investors, would be lured toward this market. I see this as one of the mortgage-related challenges and a step toward the development of the secondary market, which is not effectively available here. A well-regulated and clearly defined secondary market would naturally encourage both investors and growth.
node.sections11: In the mortgage market, it is not yet clear what the problem is at this point in time. I think even if the banks took a hit, they could absorb it. The mortgage business is still quite small and the largest mortgage banks have only SAR10 billion of exposure on their books, which is 5% of their total assets. If the banks take a 10% hit, they can write off SAR1 billion. We cannot do this, because we were established on a new model of non-salary assignment, which has never succeeded in the Saudi market before. Dar Al Tamleek’s model is closer to what you see in the rest of the world. We are being extremely careful at the moment, because we cannot take a hit. I will give you an example. The banks’ default rate in the industry by the end of 2013 was 0.65%. In our case, we had almost no defaults, and our delinquency rate was very low at 0.25%. We had 5,000 customers at the end of 2013, and only nine customers in total were late with their payments by at most three months. That is because we pay a great deal of attention to risk and credit criteria. Dar Al Tamleek will continue to do so that, as we cannot take on a lot of risk at the moment.
node.sections21: It’s important to clarify that the housing and residential market in Saudi Arabia has a special nature and issues. The housing market doesn’t have that big of a demand; there is a necessity but no demand. The economic definition is a principle that describes a consumer’s desire and willingness to pay a price for a specific good or service. This is not the case here; consumers want and have to buy, but they cant! My segment is the middle-income bracket, i.e. those who can afford to buy. They can move fast in terms of loans and mortgages. We are in retail, so we are targeting these segments en masse, and I go and camp out in places like malls and hospitals. This is my segment in terms of homebuyer clients. Of course, there is another segment in refinancing. As the rates are changing, many people do not know that through refinancing they are going to save a lot of money. We are now hiring personal financial planners. This is another segment of clients that we will target; those who have already had loans for the past 10 years and are now thinking that they need a change. We will do this for them. Nobody else but the banks is doing that for the client.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Aerospace Services
node.title: Hear Me Soar
node.sections01: What we have is diversity and specialization. For example, I was recently talking with one of our VIP clients as we were in a bid to get his aircraft under management. He called me and said that he was signing with NEXUS. When I asked why he said that, it was because in every area we had a specialist member of staff, which gave him comfort. We are not a one-man-show; NEXUS Flight Operations Services is a team with specific roles. This is what has made us successful with our customers. As far as airlines outsourcing management goes, our organization is a significant player. Airlines save by outsourcing to specialized organizations. That is how we can be cost-effective for the airlines and government customers. Today, as a whole group, we have 1,100 employees. In terms of aircraft, in 2012 we had three under management, but now we have about 23. This is only in the private sector, of course, not including the other aircraft that we support and manage in terms of commercial and ad hoc customers.
node.sections11: MEPC was established in 1992 as one of the economic offset program companies in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. The offset program aims to extend the industrial base for the aviation field. We currently provide MRO services on several engines for the Ministry of Defense (MOD). MEPC is the only company in Saudi Arabia—and the Middle East—that deals with military engines and is AS9110 certified. MEPC is also planning to expand into the commercial sector in the near future. Our main fleet is the F-15, C-130, Tornado, and other aircraft. We are looking closely at new aircraft on the market and the engines they use. Our strategy is to use our engine experience for long-term planning; for example, we do our analysis and communicate with customers to anticipate where the gaps in the industry will be in five or 10 years. Military forces will expand over the next five years, as well as the commercial side, which will provide more opportunities for MEPC.
node.sections21: Aircraft Component and Accessories Co. (AACC) started in 1988 as part of a group of four economic offset companies, and it is the only one of them that is based in Jeddah. It was started with the intention of doing maintenance work for the C-130 aircraft. The companies were all established under a royal decree in order to support military aviation in Saudi Arabia. For commercial aviation, the operators can get the services from across the globe; however, the military is much more complicated due to the regulations in force. Our perspective is to go further into Typhoon components, along with the new F-15 SA that will be delivered by 2015. We are planning to expand into new military platforms, and have the plans and equipment ready. Hopefully, we will start the overhaul for our large commercial aircraft landing gear at our new facilities, which are located at the northeast edge of the King Abdulaziz Airport in Jeddah.
node.sections31: It is important to understand the history of Boeing in the Kingdom. It can be traced back to 1945, when President Roosevelt gifted a DC-3 to King Abdulaziz Al Saud, which went on to become the nucleus of Saudi Arabian Airlines in the Kingdom. The Kingdom skipped railway and highway development, and is only now catching up. Instead, we went straight from the camel to the airplane. Some time ago, a competitor was interviewed, and the same reporter subsequently interviewed me. The competitor said they were making Saudi Arabia a home market. My response was that this has always been our home market. This is neither a slogan, nor mere talk; we are part of this economy and this country. In five years I would like to see all the initiatives we are currently working on bear fruit. Within a decade, I want us to have penetrated the manufacturing segment in the Kingdom, and have grown our support business and training services in the Kingdom, along with expanded support to existing programs.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: IT Services
node.title: Service With A Smile
node.sections01: Saudi Arabia is one of Microsoft’s highest growth markets globally, and Microsoft Arabia is our fastest growing market within the Middle East. We attribute this to the government’s desire to implement IT infrastructure that will transform Saudi Arabia into a knowledge-based economy. We are pleased to be working with many customers here, such as Saudi Arabian Airlines, to help it grow its business through the use of technology. For example, Saudia recently implemented a business intelligence platform, which gave it the ability to access a wide range of company data and make more informed decisions. This has improved its ability to compete and be profitable as an airline. This is one example of how we view our success as our customers’ success. There are also many high-performing Microsoft partners in Saudi Arabia, such as the Ministry of Finance, which has extended the Electronic Payments System (Sadad) to serve 29 million citizens.
node.sections11: Saudi Arabia is part of Xerox Middle East & Africa and within the remit of Developing Markets Operations. As of today, Saudi Xerox is the single largest Middle Eastern operation by any measure of the Xerox partners. It is with immense pride in the Xerox people in Saudi Arabia that I say this, because it is their hard work that allows us to say this. To put it into context, there are more than 89 countries represented in Xerox Middle East & Africa, and it is not just the results that make Saudi Xerox a leading light in this stable; it is capability, reliability, and consistency.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Riyadh Hotels
node.title: Down To Business
node.sections01: The development of Al Faisaliah Center was inspired and created by the King Faisal Foundation 13 years ago. Al Faisaliah, A Rosewood Hotel, was created by the same foundation that built Al Khozama, the first Rosewood hotel in the Middle East 35 years ago. Al Khozama is associated with outstanding service and quality. Al Faisaliah Hotel, when built in May 2000, was established as a five-star luxury hotel, and its name remains synonymous with quality. Al Faisaliah Hotel’s popularity index is extremely high and we have occupied the number one position for the past two years on Trip Advisor. We are also among the top ranked hotels on Booking.com and Google+. We are the first choice for hotel seekers in Riyadh, which is precisely where we want to be. From a tourism perspective, I view Riyadh as being different when compared to Jeddah. It is a corporate city, attracting a large number of business entrepreneurs.
node.sections11: The Ritz-Carlton Riyadh fits perfectly for a summer getaway where families can immerse in luxury while staying at a majestic and elegant oasis located within 52 acres of luxuriantly landscaped gardens, abundant water fountains, Chorisia trees, native palms, and 600-year-old olive trees. Splendid amenities include more than six distinctive restaurants and lounges, a lavish spa, and unprecedented service that promise an unforgettable summer getaway. The Ritz-Carlton Riyadh is one of the most luxurious hotels in the world and has won, since its opening, many international awards for the finest luxury hotels, and this contributes to it occupying first place in the Saudi market. The Ritz-Carlton Riyadh accommodates all kinds of corporate VIPs and will attract more families in the coming period with the launch of our new Ritz Kids program. The Ritz-Carlton Riyadh has redefined luxury business travel for global visitors in the Kingdom’s capital with a range of services and facilities tailored to the high-end international business guests.
node.sections21: Over the years, the reputation of Four Seasons has been built on service, and we at Four Seasons Hotel Riyadh recognize service as our key differentiator, it is the service that our people provide to guests that sets us apart. We have spent millions of dollars to make this the nicest property in the city, and underpinning this considerable investment are the people we work with. This combination is the bedrock of our success. We spend a great deal of time finding the right people and making sure they are equipped to give our guests a memorable experience. These days there is no doubt that the demands of our guests have changed as they are ultimately seeking a “meaningful“ travel experience—and in this context that means the pursuit of something that is authentic, reflects the local landscape and is enriching to them. At the end of the day, it’s not a matter of how many square meters the rooms are, or what kind of sheets and towels we use; it is really about the experience of staying at Four Seasons Hotel Riyadh.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Jeddah Hotels
node.title: Deserved Luxury
node.sections01: InterContinental was perhaps the first international hotel chain in Saudi Arabia. The first hotel was the Riyadh InterContinental, which opened 40 years ago. The brand has become extremely popular here in Saudi Arabia over the decades, to the point where there are more InterContinental hotels in Saudi Arabia than there are in any other country outside the US. That fact in itself attests to the popularity and reputation of the InterContinental brand. Today, there are 18 InterContinental hotels across the country. The InterContinental Jeddah is one of the oldest hotels in the city, and it also has one of the best reputations, having become somewhat of a classic hotel with a great heritage. Guests and employees all like the InterContinental Jeddah. How we leverage our reputation, and our brand name, is by consistency and the constant improvement of our services over the years by keeping our reputation fresh.
node.sections11: The Rosewood Corniche opened in 2007 and, since then, has introduced many new concepts to the Jeddah market, including specially trained fragrance butlers, a seemingly unusual amenity to offer guests a choice of exotic scents, and the Rosebuds program for young children. We also introduced the Red Sea Romance package. Designed exclusively for newlyweds and married couples, the package allows them to enjoy an undisturbed stay at Jeddah’s number one hotel. We were even the first hotel and entity in the Kingdom to introduce the “cronut,“ which was at that time only available exclusively in the Rosewood Corniche Soleil café. Saudi Arabia is one of the biggest travel markets in the Middle East. Growing domestic demand, a strong corporate sector, and the continued expansion of religious tourism are all fueling the development of the hotel industry. Rosewood Corniche celebrated a record year amid strong positive growth throughout 2013. The hotel’s room revenue increased by 8.2% in 2013, while occupancy levels increased by 3.7% compared to 2012. We are extremely proud to report such positive figures for 2013.
node.sections21: Jeddah is the commercial center of Saudi Arabia. As we look back in history, Jeddah was the one place that was in touch with the rest of the world, and it is a gateway to the commercial hub and for pilgrimage to the holy places. Most people, even today, have to touch down in Jeddah, either by air or sea. Jeddah still has to be passed through before going to the holy places. In the 1980s, all the embassies were based in Jeddah. All the embassies were shifted to Riyadh in the late 1980s, but until then, Jeddah was the most important place in terms of diplomacy, commerce, and tourism. The people of Jeddah are different because they have been in contact with the rest of the world for centuries. That is the beauty of Jeddah, which makes the city a very unique place. The King is based in Jeddah every summer, and during this time the city receives more attention. It is a unique place.

node.author: TBY
node.intervieweelist2company: Abdullah A. M. Al-Khodari Sons Company
node.subject: Corporate Governance
node.title: Time For Change
node.sections01: Our Board is committed to the principles of good governance and regards corporate accountability and transparency as key pillars of business success. The management in turn is relentlessly striving to adopt best global practices and standards in dealing with all business matters, no matter how small or complex, in order to promote the success of our businesses to the benefit of all our stakeholders. Additionally, since becoming a CJSC in 2010, we have implemented more rigorous policies and standards for engaging and directing our employees and other stakeholders in complying with local and international regulations and relevant laws. We have created an environment of greater transparency and accountability across the organization. Finally, we have set clear guidelines for day-to-day decision-making and behavior based on the culture and values of our organization.
node.sections11: In 2011, we changed from being a family company to a CJSC. This required a major change. The objective of the change was to separate ownership from managing the business in order to secure continuity for the group for the coming generations. Basically, a board was assigned in 2013 lead by the Chairman, Sheikh Mohammed Abdulaziz Almoajil, and decided to keep all family members away from managing the business and make their involvement limited as just shareholders or a part of the board. The Board decided to assign a CEO who would be responsible for the whole group. With me coming from a multinational background at Proctor & Gamble, Johnson & Johnson, Pepsi Co, and other major names, my objective is to implement the best practices in the market and put this group on a track where tomorrow it will be a real professional company.
node.sections21: Within the family, it was agreed to separate ownership from management long before floating the company. This is always a challenge, but becomes far easier once the company goes public. We ensured that family members’ needs and concerns were all addressed using a forum where we would all get together. It is a process whereby everybody knows they are being heard. It is important to keep the flow of information going. An annual general assembly was held prior to listing to instill the institutional culture. Restructuring was a priority for the company. My father never had the luxury of going to school, and, therefore, could not read or write. He created an empire; however, it lacked the appropriate procedures and governance that you want to ensure sustainability into the next generation. Prior to taking the company public, we really had to enforce and abide by corporate governance, which is vehemently dictated by the regulators. At that point, we started carving out businesses that were irrelevant to construction sector, to avoid confusing potential investors about what kind of business Al-Khodari was.
node.sections31: We started in 2008 creating joint ventures in niche markets with international players to provide solutions to our clients. We are in discussions now with various players in the hydrocarbon sector that provide unique solutions for common production or delivery problems. Part of our focus for the next five years, in parallel with the engineering sector growth, is to grow our non-engineering joint ventures to provide such solutions to our clients. Our focus will always be to create local value and transfer of knowledge in any partnership we enter into, whether it is manufacturing, services or technology. We created a joint venture with LISEGA from Germany, and opened a plant that began operations in early 2014 in Jubail to produce pipe support systems to support the power, petrochemical, and hydrocarbon sectors. The demand was huge, and we are actually the only ones in the Middle East to offer this.
node.sections41: I think the market has, to a certain extent, already started to react. The Saudi stock market, over the course of the past year, has grown by around 25% in terms of market capitalization. Over the same period, the Tadawul All Share Index (TASI) has outperformed the MSCI World Index, the Emerging Markets Index, whilst marginally underperforming the Frontier Markets Index. This appreciation has occurred under the backdrop of trading metrics that show a decline of 29% in YoY trading values, a 36% decline in volumes traded, and a 31% decline in transactions conducted. These statistics are positive, suggesting that investors may be adopting a longer-term investment horizon compared to historical standards, perhaps increasing their exposure to prime issuers in preemption of the entry of foreign investors.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Takaful
node.title: In It Together
node.sections01: We try to stay focused on the life investment market and the personal lines business, travel, and personal accidents. Credit and portfolio management is another key area we focus on. We do not feel that we can add much value to the motor or health insurance segments. We also do corporate insurance and are quite focused on being Saudi British Bank’s corporate customers. We have taken quite a difficult route with life insurance because that is not a compulsory line of business. Life insurance is relatively new to Saudi Arabia and has connotations to it that we need to overcome through the sharia committees to ensure its compliance with the sharia. We consciously did not get involved in compulsory lines of business. We saw that market as saturated and did not believe we could add value in that area. Therefore, many of the losses are in the medical and motor segments of the business, which we are not involved in.
node.sections11: For every new experience, time is needed to develop. I believe that the Saudi insurance market has yet to mature as regulation only began in 2003. It was in 2006 that the post-licensing era began. The Saudi insurance market is still at the start of its life and there is a learning curve, although it will eventually settle down. Experience will improve the market, and we will arrive at a more mature stage within perhaps five years time. What Saudi Arabia achieved in that time within the insurance sector is impressive given the difficulty involved; the overall experience was highly positive. In terms of size, we can talk about an unorganized market that was greatly underdeveloped, and lacking a legal framework. Yet today, we observe a market that is correctly regulated, and where the business landscape is clearly set.
node.sections21: According to 2012 reports, penetration is extremely low. The prospective for growth and the potential is huge. We think that many products should be mandatory. Currently, the compulsory products for the public are medical and motor products. Since there is a lack of awareness in the society, we see that we must increase the number of compulsory products. If we increased compulsory product penetration then the growth would be phenomenal. We conduct lectures and workshops in universities and some public sectors—it is a personal effort by our colleagues here. We have also started discussions with academics at King Saud University (KSU) on how to improve awareness among their students and what can be done. They were interested, and we offered to come and give some lectures and workshops to the students and even to prepare a Bachelor’s program for the insurance sector.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Why Saudi Arabia?
node.title: A Solid Decision
node.sections01: We are lucky enough to have an institutional legacy that we have developed with the Kingdom that dates back 80 years. It starts with the founding of the Kingdom and with the inception of the oil industry in Saudi Arabia. JP Morgan was the intermediary bank that arranged the first payment for the concession agreement between Standard Oil of California and the Saudi Kingdom. That is where it started. The relationship was further strengthened over the years through partnerships with local institutions. JP Morgan still owns 7.4% of the Saudi Investment Bank through a legacy ownership from long ago. This is what I think distinguished JP Morgan in a major way; it is not simply that we are serving clients or servicing a country in exchange of a fee. It is entrenching ourselves in the country through everything we do.
node.sections11: International Finance Corporation (IFC), the private-sector arm of the World Bank Group, conducted a regulatory review of the Saudi non-banking financial services market and recommended the government allow the establishment of specialized lease finance companies, the rationale being that they will expand and extend the credit deliver mechanism, hence increasing intermediation in the financial services market, which would enhance SME sector access to credit for productive assets. IFC invited us to be part of the joint venture to set up the first specialized leasing company in Saudi Arabia. ORIX Group has had a relationship with the IFC going back to 1977. We have set up pioneer leasing companies in many countries, such as South Korea, Thailand, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Oman, and Egypt. We were the first non-bank financial company in Saudi Arabia approved by the Saudi Arabian Monitory Agency (SAMA).
node.sections21: As the Saudi government continues to spend domestically on various healthcare, education, and infrastructure programs, we expect this investment to trickle down and have a positive effect on the economy as a whole, as the demand for various goods and services will continue to increase. This will also be positive for the country’s SME sector and will encourage more people to set up a business in Saudi Arabia and capitalize on the expected growth. Providing support to SMEs has always been the central focus of Gulf Installments Company (GIC) and Gulf Finance Corporation (GFC). We will continue to do this by providing swift, tailor-made financing solutions and advice to SMEs in Saudi Arabia.
node.sections31: SKME is a joint venture between Suido Kiko of Japan and Saudi Brothers Commercial Group of Saudi Arabia. We came to this market back in 2006 with the intention of bringing novel technologies to the water treatment sector. We are proud to have introduced the Membrane Bio Reactive (MBR) technology to sewage treatment projects in partnership with the Saudi government. We were the first company to introduce this and to have MBR technology used in government schemes. We started with the first project in Najran, and today MBR technology is found Kingdom-wide. This technology will treat wastewater, both municipal and industrial, allowing it to be recycled. In practical terms, what was once conceived of as a waste stream is now a value stream that can be reused in irrigation and numerous other processes.
node.sections41: 3M has had different forms of presence in Saudi Arabia for over 25 years now, but our physical presence has almost always been limited to Riyadh. Yet, we were able to reach other geographies within Saudi Arabia thanks to the team in place. In terms of 3M as a brand, if you talk to people in different sectors, you will find that the strength varies depending on the level of interaction and the importance of 3M products and solutions in that particular market segment. 3M is well known in medical and traffic safety systems. We have also a strong presence in the electrical market segment. It does vary, but whenever we are introducing 3M solutions to a specific market segment, we definitely leverage the strength of the 3M brand. The brand has been built over 112 years on quality and strong legal and ethical business conduct. Therefore, it is very well respected and received in a country like Saudi Arabia. Lately, 3M has started focusing more on the Saudi Arabian market and we have increased our investment and elevated our presence. The country presents many opportunities across a range of market segments, and 3M is active in 39 to 40 different segments of the economy. Naturally, one cannot do everything at once, and prioritization is the key to our success in the Kingdom.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Holding Groups
node.title: Playmakers
node.sections01: Real estate and investment have always been some of our main activities, and will continue to be in the future. The group started moving into other sectors, such manufacturing, and we established factories for cement products, Poly Sacks, pallets, and feed. Hence, whenever there is an opportunity, we invest and get behind it. When it comes to the commercial business, we are the sole agent in the GCC for Yale products, and that brand has been with us for 25-30 years. We are expanding slowly; however, we are keen to select where to expand. Our founders had excellent connections within the Kingdom and globally, as well as a great knowledge of economics. They realized in the old days that Saudi Arabia would follow developed countries simply because of its high demand, which will eventually improve the Saudi economy.
node.sections11: Our board is committed to the principles of good governance and regard corporate accountability and transparency as key pillars of business success. The management in turn is relentlessly striving to adopt best global practices and standards in dealing with all business matters, no matter how small or complex, in order to promote the success of our businesses to the benefit of all our stakeholders. Additionally, since becoming a closed joint-stock company in 2010, we have implemented more rigorous policies and standards for engaging and directing our employees and other stakeholders in complying with local and international regulations and relevant laws; we have created an environment of greater transparency and accountability across the organization; and we have set clear guidelines for day-to-day decision-making and behavior based on the culture and values of our organization. This has not only helped formalize and reinforce the direction, principles, and values that were already held within the organization, but has also positively impacted our operational efficiency, profitability, and long-term value growth.
node.sections21: If regulations, terms, and conditions applying to developers are not changed, we will face difficulties. Fortunately, the government is working to accommodate the need for legislative amendments. And while approval takes a certain amount of time—a key factor in construction—I believe we are on the right track to rendering the sector attractive for investors. The new mortgage law that recently came into effect should also revitalize the market. Yet meanwhile, the labor law has a tendency to change, and this has not been good for contractors. The government is definitely attempting to source quality contractors from the private sector, and we are hoping it will prove realistic in terms of its contracts. The larger-scale contracts affect the private sector in terms of requiring additional regulation. The labor law will affect many SMEs lacking the expertise to understand and apply it. And since accounting for around 70% of the total they comprise the most important part of the economy, and this situation needs urgent addressing. We should engage in this process gradually, however, as the regulations have the potential to benefit the move toward Saudization.
node.sections31: With our dynamic portfolio of subsidiaries and various engagements in multiple sectors, we strongly believe that we are diversifying our business activities. As for the hydrocarbons sector, we are seriously assessing new joint ventures with leading oil-related market players in the region. Human resources are key to our success, as our core business intensively depends on manpower. Talent, training, and the motivation of our employees will always continue to have a constructive impact on Zahran, and this is one of our ultimate objectives. In the coming years, we are looking forward to maintaining our leadership in our core businesses and maximizing our revenues and market share with distinctive and satisfied experience for our clients. We are always finding new ways and opportunities to set our group apart by entering into new joint ventures in new sectors in Saudi Arabia and the wider region.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Foreign Entry
node.title: Join The Party
node.sections01: Alkhair Capital is regulated by the Capital Market Authority (CMA) in Saudi Arabia and has been operating since 2009. We have licenses for brokerage, asset management, and corporate finance. In terms of asset management, we have equity funds, fixed income funds, as well as money market funds. Our current portfolio includes the Saudi equity fund, murabaha fund, in addition to the sukuk fund. We are currently planning to launch a new IPO fund that will focus on new IPOs of companies that have a strong track record in the market, and will comprise of Saudi and MENA companies. We have three public funds. One of them is the Saudi Equity Fund, which is purely Saudi. The strategy of the fund is to invest in the Saudi stock market, Tadawul. The fund has been performing well since its inception compared to the benchmark and its peers. We have launched two more funds recently: the Murabaha and Sukuk Fund. The Sukuk Fund was launched on the June 1, 2014, and the Murabaha Fund was launched earlier this year.
node.sections11: GDP growth for Saudi Arabia is going to be in the 4.5%-5% range for 2014. This is good for us. Over the last five years, the Saudi banks have experienced double-digit growth in their balance sheets, meaning the banks are growing faster than GDP, which is a good indication. Government spending, GDP growth, and oil prices are going to be in this range, so that is a good indicator that the market will be positive for the banking industry. We have two major government institutions, GOSI, and the Public Pension Agency. We also have several foreign shareholders such as JP Morgan and Mizuho Bank of Japan. However, they are not represented on the board. This is a completely Saudi company. I think the measurement of an institution depends on the size and quality of returns for shareholders. For the finance industry, it is the return on an average assets (ROAA). We want to maintain one of the highest returns on average equity (ROAE) and ROAA levels. We can achieve that with a good capital adequacy ratio (CAR). We also want to maintain our efficiency ratio to be a good percentage. We want to be an efficient bank. If we achieve these aims, there are many other initiatives that should lead to success. We are always taking the necessary risks to ensure our success.
node.sections21: One of the weak points of our stock market is its lack of major names. Saudi Bin Laden Group holds perhaps around 60%-70% of all infrastructure projects, but this is not reflected in the stock market, as it is a private company. The same applies to the retail sector; we have a large retail market, but the big names are not listed. This is also the case for the food sector, where about 80% of the market is in the hands of small convenience stores. The stock market effectively does not reflect the economy of Saudi Arabia, except for the petrochemical and oil sector, and this is essentially due to legal regulations. Even one of the biggest banks is not present on the stock market. As a result, news on infrastructure investment is not mirrored by changes on the stock market. Most involved companies are, in any case, foreign entities. This effectively means that in order to gain exposure to infrastructure projects, one must first identify a publicly traded company that stands to benefit indirectly from infrastructure investment. Failing to do so makes exposure to infrastructure projects very difficult.
node.sections31: I think it would be very positive if the CMA further opened the capital markets to foreign investment, for the country, the economy, and definitely the capital markets. It creates stability, which is something we definitely need. I think the regulator’s vision does not include foreign individual investors, but that stage will come. The main aim for it is to open the market up to the majority of institutional investors. That is what we need; long-term institutional investors that come in with more of an emphasis on corporate governance, and those that look to create diversity in investments. For sure, that would be positive and help grow the business, and create new products that we can target toward institutional investors. I think it is one of the more attractive markets. There are large amounts available that would have an immense impact on the open market. Having said that, I don’t think investors will invest large amounts and throw money the market the day it opens. I think investors will take their time to know the market better first. Will it be a good source of income? Yes. However, will it change the face of the capital markets in Saudi Arabia in a day? No. I think it will take years before it gets to that stage. But, that is healthy. You don’t want everything to get shaken up all at once.
node.sections41: We have been preparing for the arrival of foreign investment for quite some time. We are properly positioned for whatever changes may come, especially through our brokerage business since allowing foreign investors to participate and invest in the Saudi market will definitely increase both market efficiency and liquidity. We at Alinma Investment Company are sure that our developed and sophisticated dealing platform will attract most of the foreign investors, which will improve and increase our local brokerage market share. Foreign investors also might increase volatility and risk in the market, thus increasing the correlation between the Tadawul and world indices. I believe SAMA could play an important role in any opening of the market by monitoring and regulating capital flows into and out of the country as it may participate in preventive action for “hot money,“ and coordinate with the Ministry of Finance, CMA, and the Tadawul to find solutions and put regulations that increase efficiency and mitigate side effects of foreigners entering the market.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Ease Of Payment
node.title: Pay To Play
node.sections01: There is a transformation from paper to paperless and from delayed responses to instant. The days where people write to you and expect a response in a week is gone. You can’t have someone call you and tell them you’ll get back to them in a week; people want instant responses. Therefore, as a company, we have to cater for our Cardmember needs. That is why we need to improve our mobile technology, interactive technology, and online services to make sure Cardmember gets instant service. The access to information real time and the immediacy factor means that Cardmembers want more control over what they see and how and when they see it. And to this avail, we have changed our strategy to cater for these growing needs. With over 180% mobile penetration and as one of the highest consumers of digital media, the Saudi market offers a contrasting image whereby you still have a generation that requires paper-based transactions, while they also want to deal with people not platforms and require personalized services.
node.sections11: There are three drivers that contribute to the growth of the banking and payment sector in Saudi Arabia. First, the Kingdom has a large population of just under 30 million, a large portion of which is unbanked, creating significant growth potential. Second, the Kingdom has improved infrastructure in areas like internet communications and banking, and that is an important engine of growth for us. Third, there is room for improvement in terms of acceptance by individual merchants. We currently have around 100,000 POS terminals around the country, where cardholders can pay for goods and services. Still, according to the Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency (SAMA), we can expect to reach 500,000 in the next three years.
node.sections21: The future of payments is mobile. By encouraging coordination between the country’s financial sector and the telecommunications industry, Saudi Arabia could bolster the strength of its current offerings and make mobile payments a larger part of the payments ecosystem, which will bring the country significant savings of nearly 1.2% to 1.5% of GDP. Saudi Arabia is a key focus for MasterCard in the Middle East and Africa region, as the country is witnessing a significant growth in the adoption of electronic payment solutions. In fact, with 5 million annual visitors, Riyadh ranks 19th globally and second in the Middle East and Africa by expected International Overnight Visitors in 2013 by MasterCard’s Global Destination Index, which analyzes a global network of 132 cities, their connectivity through cross-border air travel, and associated expenditures.

node.author: TBY
node.intervieweelist1company: Clí­nica Colombiana de Obesidad y el Metabolismo
node.intervieweelist2company: Cluster Servicios de Medicina y Odontologí­a
node.subject: Health Sector
node.title: In Fine Form
node.sections01: Colombia's regulatory framework is highly favorable for multinational pharmaceutical companies. It is in fact rather economical to develop R&D activities. The environment has led to many of these large companies developing some of their primary multinational clinical research in our country. Colombia is at a crossroads and has to decide in which direction it wants to develop its pharmaceutical sector. Brazil, India, and Israel, some 20 years ago, decided to strengthen the production of generic drugs, each developing highly robust industries. Only now have these countries turned to research and innovation within the industry to take a step forward. Colombia lacks innovation and the country's industry is currently undergoing a transitional period in which an important decision must be taken regarding this deficit. The pharmaceutical market represents around 17% of the health industry in Colombia in spending terms. I think these figures also show rather low spending on medication; for example, the annual per capita health expenditure in Spain is $2,400, and at $4,000 in Italy. The figure in Colombia currently stands at $500, meaning that we have solid growth potential.
node.sections11: One of the greatest achievements in health in Colombia has been the correct identification of the sector’s problems and the work done by the last few governments to prioritize and implement key projects. Also, today every municipality, region and department has governing bodies to assure the correct development of the sector. I think the country has taken very positive steps in many specific fields of the health tourism industry. Plastic surgery is an excellent example. The overall number of foreign patients in Colombia grows annually on the back of the high-quality treatments and surgeries we offer, our competitive costs, and the follow-up care our hospitals provide. In this context, the industry now delivers several pre- and post-operation packages to foreign patients, which allows us to better target patients abroad. The clinic has enjoyed high and regular levels of success throughout its entire history and now that I lead the Center, the key challenge is maintaining these levels of growth both among local and foreign tourist segments. One of my other main goals is further research and development of new and improved procedures for our patients.
node.sections21: In Medellí­n, around 2,400 companies work in the health industry, of which some 140 engage with the provision of services for our cluster. Of those, 25, which are mostly clinics and hospitals, take part directly in the management of our cluster, being its backbone today. Our main focus since day one has been foreign patients, and our strategy and work is a part of a wider effort from the city to internationalize Medellí­n and strengthen its position in the global market in which the city has the capability to efficiently compete. This was the strategy during the early years of our cluster, and we recently revised the strategic lines of our future development, having concluded that we now have sufficient maturity, knowledge, and experience to offer more comprehensive products and services, with greater added value, to those international markets. We are currently working on further specializing our health tourism offering by encouraging the export of biotechnology products and services, as well as applied knowledge for the healthcare industry.

node.author: TBY
node.subject: Tourism Operators
node.title: Come and See
node.sections01: We are trying to become increasingly involved in the MICE business. We have appointed a destination management company for the Cartagena Boat Show, which took place on March 22-24, 2014. Aviatur also has an organization for business and corporate passengers attending exhibitions and fairs. The business that is growing the fastest, but never fast enough, is aviatur.com, our online business. The website offers airline tickets with most of the airlines here, as well as tours and hotels. That is the optimum means of maintaining contact with young people who make up the web generation. Colombia is a brand that could be adapted to anything. And while it offers all types of tourist attractions, our future is definitely ecological, green, and highly specialized. The Pacific Coast of Colombia is amazing, and it could be interesting to develop more responsible projects in this part of the country. And what's more, lasting peace in the country would help to develop the tourism segment hugely.
node.sections11: There are essentially two types of foreign tourists visiting Colombia today, namely business visitors and vacationers. About 85% of tourists come to Colombia for business, mostly going to Bogotá, since it is both the political and business capital of Colombia. The vacationers mostly come for beach tourism, which is primarily located on the Atlantic coastline, with the main destinations being Cartagena and Santa Marta. When it comes to Colombian nationals, about 70% are business tourists, and 30% are vacationers. The most popular destinations for Colombian businessmen are Medellí­n, Barranquilla, and Cali, and they mostly come from Bogotá. There is also a considerable degree of religious tourism, mainly during Holy Week, known in Spanish as “Semana Santa." The most important work we do is promotional campaigns, and we work through the Pacific Alliance, which integrates a series of important countries such as Peru, Chile, and Mexico. The citizens of Pacific Alliance countries can now travel without a visa to all other countries in the alliance zone, which has simplified our job, and we are intensifying our promotional campaigns to take advantage of this.
node.sections21:
Santa Marta has many touristic attractions; from heavenly beaches, such as the ones in the Tayrona National Park, to the many historic spots across the city. Santa Marta was the first city to be founded in South America, on July 29, 1525, by Spanish explorer Rodrigo de Bastidas.

The city is undergoing a cultural revival, and is developing a new museum in the historic center of the city, which will strengthen the network of cultural institutions in Santa Marta. Prices in cities on the Caribbean coast have risen sharply in recent years due to greater demand for second homes; this combined with the fact that they had maintained the lowest price levels in the region, despite being tourism destinations.
